title: Educational Outcome Structure Design for Inclusive Transformation in Higher Education: A UDL-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental language proficiency and university-level academic habits
context.additional_context: A blended classroom environment that accommodates students with diverse learning backgrounds.

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more learning strategies that reflect personal learning preferences according to Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles
Learners can provide two or more feedback instances considering peers' learning styles through collaborative learning in an inclusive educational environment
Learners can self-assess their personal potential (creativity, flexibility, self-regulation) on a three-level scale during educational outcome evaluations.

resources: Online Discussion Tool for Collaborative Learning
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
